documentation.text:
@notice The (older) MasterChef contract gives out a constant number of SUSHI tokens per block.
 It is the only address with minting rights for SUSHI.
 The idea for this MasterChef V2 (MCV2) contract is therefore to be the owner of a dummy token
 that is deposited into the MasterChef V1 (MCV1) contract.
 The allocation point for this pool on MCV1 is the total allocation point for all pools that receive double incentives.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RewardsManager.PoolInfo storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: @notice Returns the number of MCV2 pools.

documentation.text:
@notice Sets the sushi per second to be distributed. Can only be called by the owner.
 @param _sushiPerSecond The amount of Sushi to be distributed per second.

@notice Migrate LP token to another LP contract through the `migrator` contract.
 @param _pid The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct RewardsManager.UserInfo storage ref))

documentation.text:
@notice Update reward variables for all pools. Be careful of gas spending!
 @param pids Pool IDs of all to be updated. Make sure to update all active pools.

attributes.text:
@notice The (older) MasterChef contract gives out a constant number of SUSHI tokens per block.
 It is the only address with minting rights for SUSHI.
 The idea for this MasterChef V2 (MCV2) contract is therefore to be the owner of a dummy token
 that is deposited into the MasterChef V1 (MCV1) contract.
 The allocation point for this pool on MCV1 is the total allocation point for all pools that receive double incentives.
@notice Returns the number of MCV2 pools.
